I specifically like the location, it's quiet yet near the establishments you'd need to go to. The rooms we got were also amazing. I like the master's bedroom we stayed in, it's got floor-to-ceiling windows giving us a panoramic view of sukhumvit. ğŸ˜Š

We wasted 2 hours trying to sort out our booking and they wanted to move us to a 2 star hostel instead of the 4star apartment that we had booked. they told us that they werent any available rooms or apartment left, but when we try to search again via Booking.com and Agoda.com, both apartments and rooms are still available on the website during the duration of our stay. I have even paid everything in full 3 weeks prior to our trip and reconfirmed our reservations via email 3 times (final time with a response while the first 2 was ignored)Eventhough the rooms are nice and the location is not bad. Do avoid at all cost if you do not want to end up almost spoiling your holiday. We have to delay our dinner reservations at very hard to book restaurant and lucky that they were able to accommodated us at a later time.Hot water in the master bedroom is not consistent.

novotel-bangkok-platinum.description:
Conveniently located in Pratunam area. Platinum mall is within the same building. Highly recommended for shopaholics, you donâ€™t have to leave the vicinities. Walking distance to Siam Paragon and Erawan. Lots of food options too. 
Room is a tad small for the price. The high priced is due to location and Novotel brand.

Location, comfort, room style, sofa bed, bathroom style. 
The carpet of the room was with old yellowish and black stains that can not be removed even the sides of the bed, and the worst thing ever that I didn't like is that I deposit 5,000 Baht safety deposit for 7 nights, then after the 3rd day they asked for another 5,000 Baht safety deposit just because of my laundry bill reached around 9,000 Baht but it never happened to me something like that beside I always stay in this hotel when visiting Bangkok, every hotels I stayed in never did that because what happened in novotel it's like pay in advance not safety deposit and I asked them to show me the policy with article number but they never did, they showed me check in paper that I signed it and it has nothing to do with what happened, the hotel acted cheap it's like I'm going to run away or check out without paying them. And I asked them for the second time why is the extra deposit ! They said it's just to guarantee their money... Would you imagine ! And another staff spoke to me on the phone said that I have to deposit 5,000 at least to accept my laundry otherwise they will not accept my cloths to be washed ! Wow ! ... In the end the manager came to my room and apologized to what happened he said the hotel was not clear about this thing and he just started to work in this hotel it's been around 3 months and the reason why he came because I requested him. By the way the laundry bill reached approximately 18,000 Baht when I checked out and it's been paid without any problems,  but this time what happened  during my stay was weird, strange... Ah let's not forget, the TV is not smart and small + the shower of the bathroom has to be covered by curtain to prevent water spreading.

Breakfast and Christmas Eve Dinner were simply delicious and amazing. The team in the restaurant was welcoming and were always smiling. Daily breakfast was simply a great experience. HK team who cleaned our rooms for 4-days was AMAZING he was extremely friendly and is always with a happy smile and super polite.
Spa receptionist was not available had to wait for 30-minutes plus and no one at the gym could assist. The pool area is run down and not maintained well, gazebos were mostly not available as they were damaged. Executive Lounge team and the VIP Check-In team are not friendly as the team at the normal reception counter. They were not attentive and did not converse while doing the arrival nor were welcoming when we proceeded to the Executive Lounge for refreshments or snack.

If Center required then this is the best place for shopping and metro bkk
Entrance

The hotel was perfect to me , the location was great , the staff was good , the breakfast was excellent
I personally did not like the bathroom. There was no glass door to separate the shower area to the main bathroom area. This in turn caused water to splash out of the shower area and go to the main  bathroom area , hence accumulating over there.

The waiter/waitress at breakfast are not exactly hard working. They never come to my table at all to clear any of the plates. However during my 4 nights stay, I was always given a big table therefore i can stack the plates on the empty space. The house keeping also can be improved a lot. My mom dropped a piece of cake with nut crumble on top on our first night there, we threw away the cake hoping that they would vacum the crumble. On our check out day, the crumbles were still there. The hotel does not have a direct elevator to the room. You have to change elevator from the lobby to go to the rooms.

Over the years, my go to hotel is Pathumwan Princess. Novotel Bangkok Platinum Pratunam is slowly becoming my preference. You guys are doing a great job, keep it up. The services shown by the check-in staff to the lounge, to the restaurant and to the ladies who made up my room had always been top notch.
The reward program. Apparently I booked my rooms through booking.com for my stay. Was told this time round that it was it does not qualify for points even if I paid for the same price. I am in no position to comment much on the hotel stand, however I strongly believe that I did the same previously and was not told of this stand. Was my points given frankly I am not too sure, however I find that if indeed this is the case, Novotel should have told me since day one not after a few booking.
I liked that they have listened to thier customers and added halal food in thier buffet.

Room was on 22nd floor with an amazing view. Good effort with getting guest to put their un used plastic shopping bags into the bin for recycling... Bravo!
Breakfast spread was good... Plates were cleared away quite frequently.
The coffee machine in the room was a pleasant surprise. The daily cookie placed in the evening on our beds... A nice personal gesture! 
The check in & check out could have been smoother/quicker. When it was high volume of guests all waiting there was only 1-2 staff attending to everyone. Noticed you have a seperate side for Accor members. Suggestion when it is not busy /no guest to attend to at the Accor check in the staffers there can also help out at the normal front desk area.
The room:
The air con difference in the room is abit too drastic; can be adjusted more evenly. The bathroom should have a door to seperate the shower area.. If not one gets easily cold stepping out of the shower and it not a nice feeling! 
The escalator connecting hotel to Platinum shopping mall is wonderful though the opening and closing time / when the escalator will stop - signage to be placed more prominently for guest information or placed in the rooms.

This is definitely one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. I probably won't be able to afford to stay here again as we got an incredible deal. The room was amazing with the best view from the bath. Right next to the EmQuarter shopping mall and a pretty park. The rooftop bar is fabulous, cool DJ and lush cocktails. The breakfast was delicious with yummy warm chocolate croissants and a make your own pancake machine that my daughter loved.

The location was excellent, next to the Emporium Mall and 2 minutes walk to the Sky Train. One stop up the road you’re at Terminal 21 or Soi Cowboy (different ends of the spectrum - but you are in Bangkok!).The entrance to the hotel was in keeping with a luxury hotel and the staff were attentive and polite. There was always a pleasant smell in the foyer.The room was quiet and beds comfy. The shower was good and there was a bath.Room service was excellent. Normally we rarely use it, but because we were jet lagged we ordered food at unusual times and it was excellent, as was the food in the Sky bar.WiFi was consistently good.Price was good compared to other 5 star hotels.
The room was no better than an average 4 star hotel. Tea and coffee making facilities were below that of a 3 star hotel. There was no milk to make a tea/coffee. We rang reception and was charged 120 bhat for a glass of milk so that we could have white tea/coffee, which for a 5 star hotel was very disappointing.The TV had very limited channels.The view from our room looked directly to another building. We kept the curtains closed so it didn’t really bother us, but if you want a view check with the hotel first.Best to compare this hotel with other average 4 star hotels, that way it would be a very good choice. As such we would recommend it, especially on price.

The hotel was amazing! We paid a little extra to have rooms on the river side, and the views were phenomenal. Sunsets from our balconies were fantastic. The rooms were spacious, clean, and furnished nicely. The 2 bedroom suite our adult children stayed in had a kitchenette and a nice dining table to eat and visit together. Our suite also had a kitchenette and nice furniture. Robes, slippers, and nice toiletries as well. The breakfast and dinner buffet was expensive, but absolutely 5-stars-gourmet! The staff were kind and helpful. The river taxi was fun to use to go places. The pool is gorgeous, and the pool bar was fun. Everything was just starting to be closed for COVID-19, but we will definitely stay here again.
The basic items needed for meals in the kitchenette (napkins/silverware/bowls/plates) wasn't replaced after being used, so we had to ask for it a couple times.

The best thing of this very modern and well equipped hotel was for sure the stunning view from my room over Chao Phraya river and skyscrapers around, both at night and in the day (you must choose a River View room). I came many times in the last years in Bangkok, but this is the first time in this hotel, because I go normally in a different area. I had just one day to spend in Bangkok after my trip in Chiang Mai and I choose this hotel because it is along Chao Phraya river and in a quiet area of the city. I am fully satisfied of my choice: when I arrived I found very professional personnel and I appreciated a lot they allowed me to check in a bit earlier than normal time and to check out 2 hours later than normal time scheduled.
Then: huge modern room, very comfy bed, big bathroom, balcony at a high floor with superb views all around, perfect cleanliness, free fruit plate in the room.
Breakfast with wide choice of sweet treats and salted food, cooked food (rice, noodles, pasta, chicken, fish), yoghurt, cereals, smoothies, fresh fruit, egg station, ......
The last night I had dinner at restaurant River Barge and I experienced tasty Thai food, beautiful quite ambience, professional and discrete service by the waitress that served me. For dinner they have a wide buffet at a fixed price and as well A la Carte menu (I opted for it): you can it inside or outside, in the light evening breeze, looking at the river, the boats that pass on it and the stunning view all around.
The hotel has also a complimentary (and very frequent) service by boat from its pier to Saphan Taksin (and back, of course) where you can take the BTS Metro Station to go easily in any area of the city. 
If I need in the future to come again to Bangkok and stay in that area, I'll choose for sure again this hotel. I have already recommended it to a couple of people that I know have plans to visit Bangkok within the next two years.

This was an amazing, actual 5 star-like, hotel! My friend and I were very sad since our flight was moved up and we were only staying here half a night rather then a full night/day since it was such a nice hotel. Plenty of restaurants on site and really nice pool area. They upgraded us from a 1 bedroom to a 2 bedroom suite and it was honestly nicer then the apartments that we live in. It was massive with large comfortable beds! We even had 2 balconies with amazing views. The staff was very nice with easy check-in/out.
We didn't really go out an explore Bangkok since we were short on time so I can't comment on location, but they did have a personal hotel boat to bring guests to different areas on the river. The showers were very hard to get hot water, not sure if we weren't turning the nobs the right way or what was the issue, but eventually got hot water in 1 of the 2 showers.

Many thanks for the flexible handling of the check-out in difficult times. We got a good parking space for our commercial truck. The connection of the hotel to the public ferry traffic and the rapid railways via the hotel's own ferryboat works perfectly. Praise must be given to the swimming pool in which one can swim long distance at a comfortable temperature that is not too high.
The breakfast is very good for non-Asian people, who also likes Asian food in the morning, misses for example a curry.
The staff was amazing, we stay between March 25-27, 2020. During Corona Outbreak, so some services like gym and pool were closed, but the treat us really well. Thank you

Most everything about this places was of very high quality. Our one night stay was prepaid so we were taken aback on arrival by the demand for a credit card deposit of 1000 TB  - something about a mini bar guarantee. We felt like clients at the service counter of a low-cost car hire company rather than at the desk of a four star hotel. We protested and after some time the people on the desk relented. We had similar feelings when we asked for a late checkout. This was kindly granted at half the rate of a  full booking. We were ok with that arrangment. When I noted the half day rate I was quoted was more than than half what we had paid for the room  we were told that the hotel was using the rate for the day. But when I (immediately) compared this rate  to Booking.com rate for the day I was surprised to learn the rate quoted was actually  higher that the Booking.com rate. We decided to leave things be.

Love to stay at the Centre Point Sukhumvit 10. The hotel has become our home away from home when we are in Bangkok.  We use this hotel since 2015.    This time we got an upgrade to a larger two bedroom apartment. On floor 27. Wonderful views. Staff is great, helpful and solution oriented.   The Tuktuk to the main road is very helpful. There are many eateries around. This time, there was a street food market with live music, just at the end of the Soi.    Great experience as well. The reception organized a trip by long boat for us on the Chao Praya river which worked seamlessly (car and boat) as well as a private taxi to the airport.  The hotel has luggage storage as well. What else can I say.  Please come and stay and enjoy!

Location is also ok (you can always take the mini shuttle they’re providing every 10min to the main road/Terminal 21/Asok&Sukhumvit station). Trust me location is not as bad as you might see in a map.
Don’t open the balcony esp during night. Otherwise you might find troublesome sleeping with mosquitoes buzzing around you haha(this applies to all the hotels in Thailand)

Everything. Location, staff, service, boat ferry and the most eclectic, wonderful breakfast offerings.

Hard to add to what I've already said in earlier reviews.  The breakfast buffet is, in a word, *exquisite*.  They have 2 chefs, one specializing in Asian cuisine, the other in making omelettes Western style.  The selection of food is glorious: fresh juice, waffles, pancakes made on the spot, pastries, rice soup (my wife's favorite), a selection of yogurts, fruit, vegetables, bacon, sliced cheese and meats, and an excellent array of Thai breakfast favorites.  The breakfast area has both indoor and outdoor seating, with a fabulous river view.  There are two swimming pools, one just above the river patio, the other across the way in an immaculately kept secluded garden area.  The hotel provides a free river boat shuttle that takes you to the nearest BTS station, a service we took advantage of quite often.  Free parking is provided, which is a must if you are crazy enough to drive to Bangkok (uh ... yes, call me crazy!).
This time around I wasn't careful in my booking and managed to secure a room but without the lovely breakfast.  Arghhh!!!  So I had to fork out extra to include the breakfast.  It so happened the hotel had a promotion, however, and we ended up having to only pay 400 THB each, whereas the normal price is a whopping (but well worth it) price of 800 THB.  So ... my main complaint would be that the Sheraton is a bit on the pricey side ... but well within the norm for this class of hotel in Bangkok, especially given its location directly on the main river.

It's a very good hotel, although I would say that there's not a great deal to do within walking distance of the hotel. There is the free shuttle over to IconSiam which is the most incredible shopping centre, with great value food on the lower floor. The water taxis are easily accessible and good value to get to the Royal Palace. Do not overlook the happy hour (think it was 6-8pm) and other options which make a drink decent value. Also the breakfast is a really good option and by sheer volume alone will keep you going all day and work out cheaper than anywhere nearby. I'd definitely recommend the hotel to others.

If you like to have a few breakfast rounds, I'd say leave an hour! 
The gym is great, we used it quite late in the evenings and it was empty (joys of jetlag). For a hotel gym it is very well equipped with a number of different resistance machines as well as mix of weights and a Smith machine. We didn't use the pool but it looked nice. 
We ate in Thara Thong one night and it was delicious but MEGA expensive. We'd only just arrived in Thailand as this was our first stop and had we been out and about we probably would have realised how expensive it was in comparison to out and about but the service was great, the restaurant has a lovely authentic feel to it that we didn't get anywhere else.

I was surprised since no other guests were leaving and there was a good number (3-4) of staff in the front door. Not a single one offered to help take our bags. Don't get me wrong, I don't really expect to be served hand and foot, but the the kind service that we got from day one, I half expected some one to help at that point. It made me feel a little like..."hey you are already leaving our hotel, so we don't need to put our best foot forward.Also I had an incident with my omelette tasting different (it was bad tomatoes as confirmed by the manager after she checked when I brought it) during one of my breakfasts.

- Location was just amazing and perfect to visit everything. I was worried, before arriving if this part of the city could be a good starting point to sightseeing the city but once we arrived we felt like was the best choice. We even had food stalls under the MBK center that were so cute. The surroundings are just perfect because there is everything you need and it's a nice neighborhood always crowded and safe.
Skytrain and all public transport so much near. We honestly used most of the time taxis since they're so cheap and the hotel catches them for you. You can choose to get one with the taxi meter on or a fixed price. Our fare from the airport to the hotel was 350 bahts and hotel- airport was 340 plus highway tolls.
- Everyone is friendly and help you with your needs without hesitation.
- The room is very much clean and comfortable, beds are very good and they have a wide selection of pillows you can choose from. They give you free water bottles everyday.
- Room service is amazing, their food is great and have good prices.
- there is a 7 eleven two meters away which provides you everything you could ever need.
- MBK center is in the same building of the hotel and has different entrances from inside so it's very comfortable doing some shopping there and bringing into the room the heavy bags before heading out again to visit the city.
- The swimming pool is huge! Amazing and relaxing.
- The quality of sleep is very good. You can set the temperature of the room as you like.
-The room is so spacious and we'll equipped, you can open all the baggage you want.
- Guests are sometimes way too loud at night when they come back or in the morning when they go away. This means that rooms must be better isolated.

All the service was good. Breakfast was nice though it has many country's food, and room condition is also nice, and especially bathroom. Bath is near the window and it is good to take a bath while I can enjoy the view outside.

The room is very clean and completed amenities.
The staff was great, they were all so friendly, accommodating and welcoming! The staff provided great service and made our stay in Bangkok so special and memorable! Thank you!!

The hotel is in a good central position with quick access to all the main sites of Bangkok. The staff are all very friendly and well trained, they quickly helped answer questions and ordered reliable taxis extremely rapidly.  The room itself was a good size, with nice bed view of the city especially from the bathroom where there was a nice tub and wet room style shower. The restaurant was nice and food pretty good,  with a spectacular view in a relaxed atmosphere, the bar on the very top had a incredible view of the city 360 degrees around. The pool on the 6th floor in the evening was empty and so we enjoyed a nice cooling swim, which was great.
The lighting for the pool area in the night was very bad, you could barely see anything around! The cost of the hotel, food and drinks I think is too high for Bangkok.. similar to prices at home in Switzerland, so this was a bit disappointing. My partner said that there was a bit of smell in the room...

Especially, I was impressed with the delicious meal especially in the morning such as kind appearance to the staff and clean bed service.
The view was bad because the construction site was in front. And it didn't look good because it had a low 23rd floor.

We had a beautiful room with an amazing view of the city. The location is great, very central. The gym is proper for a hotel gym and the pool is lovely. 
There is a rooftop bar on the top floor, so if you want to get to your room in the evening, be prepared to wait a while for the elevator, as it can take a lot of time. 
Unfortunately, there was a building being constructed right in front of the pool side, which made the view a bit ugly, but thats to no fault of the hotel.

It’s a beautiful hotel. The lobby, pool, restaurant, and room are all superb. The breakfast was amazing. The location is great too. We stayed in a premier deluxe room with a beautiful city view. The rooftop bar is amazing. The staff were all super nice as well. 

When we got to our room, we wanted to relax before going out to explore. We tried to watch TV but it was not working. This may be tedious but there was only had 1 robe in the room. These things were not a huge deal but it was a bit frustrating to deal with after a long day. Just expected more from a 5 star hotel.

I loved the Octave Sky Bar and the hospitability of the staff. Huge compliments and many thanks to all the staff I met. Great breakfast, especially the fresh juice bar. Very comfortable bed. The use of Grab application to call taxi drivers was an excellent alternative to avoid regular taxi scammers with whom we had some unfortunate experiences.
The 45 th floor Restaurant to be avoided. Impression: fast food dishes at 5 star restaurant prices. No bread or rice available to be served with the food, limited dishes also.Shukumvit area is too crowded and less attractive than other parts of Bangkok, but its sky bar should be a must on your list.

The hotel is lovely, it exceeded our expectations. It is in a great location for the Sky train which allows you to travel easily around Bangkok (avoiding the crazy traffic). Our room was amazing, we was on the 29th floor, we had an amazing view from our bedroom and bathroom. The rooftop bar was a great feature, the drinks were great and the view was top draw. The infinity pool is also nice for relaxing. All the staff are so attentive and helpful, the concierge recommended a water market which was a great day out!

Perfect location, 5 min walk to Skytrain. Also has an amazing rooftop bar. Staff were extremely attentive. 
Has a food market just round the corner. Definately reccommend.

I pulled up in a Toyota Fortuner with the audacity to be black and checking into such a place and the doorman, in Thai, asked the driver if I was checking in. I let him know that I was. He then passed my door without opening it as he had intended to do in the first place but then noticed that I am black and decided to skip it. Don't worry, I called him back to open the door. They also sent the cleaner to my room while I was getting ready to leave to ask me if I was checking out. I didn't understand why. When I said something to the front desk girl about it she raised her voice at me, pretty much the ultimate in rudeness in Thai culture.  I would say customer service is hit or miss. Cleanliness could have been better as well. There was a stain that looked like blood on the floor and cabinet of the bathroom in the first room they put me in and a white creamy stain appeared on the door while I was showering in the second.

siam-kempinski-bangkok.description: What I love about Siam Kempinski is their attention to detail. It is the little things that make this hotel unique. I had a really exceptional experience and can't wait to go back.

The Siam Kempinski was perfect in so many ways, but mostly it was perfect in what was most delicious important to us. Location is ideal, the hotel decor and grounds are exquisite and so inviting, rooms are well appointed and beds comfortable, but, most importantly, the welcoming staff and their attentive service make this a place you look forward to returning to after a day in the hustle and bustle of this amazing city! We would like to make a special note to mention our first encounter during check in with Ms. Rungaroon set the tone for our 5 night stay. Her polite demeanor and outstanding customer service, combined with the wonderful Thai warmth and hospitality, truly made our arrival at Siam Kempinski memorable. She then offered us an upgrade which made the stay all the more enjoyable! All these wonderful encounters and the attention to detail (too many to list!) make this THE ONLY place to stay! 
Maybe time to replace the rugs in the suites as they seemed worn out.

One of the most comfortable stays in Bangkok. I've stayed in many places in the capital city of Thailand - however, Carlton is now one of my favourite hotels! I love the modern and convenient style with very attentive staff. Nevertheless, your privacy is kept greatly. The sports center & swimming pool is clean and there is anything you need. The rooms are clean and nicely designed. Loved everything about it. Anytime again!
Cannot think about anything, what I didn't like. Was a very pleasant stay.

The room was not dark enough, light was coming in through the top of the curtains and the air-condition control panel emitted a strong green light. You should not interrupt a conversation and ask if you can take away a small plate - happened more than once.

I stayed 3 weeks in this hotel after extending multiple times. It's a new hotel and looks nice.  Rooms are clean. Gym has good equipment. Most of the staff are friendly but it's hit and miss.  I think the staff could do with some additional training.
They require full payment in advance upon checkin + 2000 per day deposit.  So if you're staying 1 week, you're paying fully in advance and then also having a 14,000 baht hold on your credit card.  I think thats a ridiculous policy, given that it can take 3 weeks for that money to release on your card. I tried to discuss it with the front office manager but I found her to be a rude arrogant woman. I explained all other 5 star hotels I've been too don't operate this way. I tried to ask for the hotel manager, she tried to claim she's the hotel manager. Not so, since I met the hotel manager a few days earlier (a foreigner).The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night across the entire hotel.  So the lobby was full of people. That's where I met the hotel manager mentioned above as he came in from home.  He said it's a malfunction and I noticed they had to kill the system for a day or two as the red light wasn't flashing on the smoke detector.They have a silly policy of not allowing grab or foodpanda riders to simply ride up to the front of the hotel to deliver food.  Security force them to go around the back of the hotel through boom gates, get a parking card, and all this rubbish.  Completely unnecessary and confusing for the riders and the guests.They claim the restaurant is open 24 hours for room service.  In actual fact the restaurant closes at 9pm and if you order food after 9pm you can only choose from the "night menu" which has about 5 things on it.  No Thai food whatsoever. Only Burgers, pasta, that type of stuff.  The stuff an assistant can heat in the microwave.

You can go around the area, shopping mall nearby.
Doorman was kinda rude, looks uncomfortable to serve. doorman didnt greet from the first meeting at the taxi getting off, didnt bring my baggage off from taxi, and did not bring up to the table in the room, mean he did not ask where is good to put the baggage even he came in to the room inside in this corona situation, so why he needs to come in to that room in corona situation.Even just going through the entrance was the time to see he shows uncomfortable to open the door for me. But all other door was closed. So I did not go out anywhere after once I saw it. the other girl stuff also made face of telling wifi password after check out to call grab, and did not answer "You are welcome" nor anything after I said "Thank you". 5 star? Really? Pool was needed to precook so not flexible.No corona partition at lobby and full of people speaking anywhere.
Marble floors in room

Overall the property was very good staff are nice rooms are good sizes and pool is amazing 
Just a couple of things that disappointed me firstly the room service one of the meals made me sick the calamari tasted like it had some cleaning product on it I also asked for some sauce and they forgot. This was disappointing as when I reported this to reception they just said sorry they didn’t even take off the bill. 
The second was they tried to over bill me in the cooling tower I also wanted to reserve the table with the best view as was my birthday and had friends coming and even though I was a guest they gave booking to outside party who were not staying in the hotel this is quite disappointing for a hotel being 5 stars as guests should always be given priority. 
This was added too a disappointment as they could not even get us a table in the Cantonese restaurant even though we asked two days prior.

The location is good and ideal for money. I love the bathroom. The service for lunch on the first day I arrived was outstanding. I was in a rush for a meeting - advising your staff that I'll come by to finish and they kept the food for me and delivered to my room thank you. I arrived before check in time and the reception & hk managed to get me a room in time for my meeting at 2pm thx!
The service for breakfast wasn't really good. Maybe I was there at 9:40am almost closing time. The toasts came out first with no utensils until I had to ask for them. Not a big problem but I expect to have that part of a service mind. The scrambled eggs came out cold though. The Cesar salad dressing was way too sour. You may be asking well I did finish the food, yes because I was hungry. One of the waiters serving water spilled some water on my table without apologising and rushing away. Anyways breakfast this time is not so good - the quality and the service. On Saturday night, I honestly expected a lot for the cooling tower. Unfortunately the location of the seats are just ridiculous especially a long sofa in which it should be facing the view outside not inside facing other guests. Didn't like the mojito ordered - i should have told the bartender but it's ok not a big deal. The staff was good though - very attentive thank you!

良くない点ではないのですが、エグゼクティブルームを予約していたので、ホームページに記入してあった、レイトチェックアウト3時をホテルにメールで確認しましたが、「レイトチェックアウト特典の資格がない。 ただし、ご要望にお応えできるよう最善を尽くします。 到着時の空き状況によります。」との回答でした。当日チェックイン時確認しようとしましたが、混雑しているのと既に3時にチェックアウト時間になっていたので、事実は確認はしませんでした。

отличный новый отель , номера небольшие но продуманные ,все удобно , современный дизайн , дорогая сантехника в санузле , умный унитаз ))панорамное окно с красивым видом на город, автоматические шторы блэкаут, бассейн небольшой и не глубокий но симпатичный, вполне хватает что бы освежиться ) . Местоположение хорошее , метро рядом , да и в пешей доступности много чего есть ) кровать удобная , подушки двух видов мягкие и поплотнее , не пуховые но норм . За такую цену я считаю очень все хорошо , мне понравилось

Момент с феном я не понял ) фен как бы есть , но вот розетки для него в ванной нет ) нет ее и в коридоре перед зеркалом ) можно сушиться перед выключенным телевизором )) В связи с ковидными мерами закрыт руфтоп бар , да и все рестораны в отеле , работает только кафе в лобби , но это не проблема отеля
De kwaliteit van service en faciliteiten

Det bedste hotel , jeg har boet på Bangkok. Er kun 12 mdr gammelt - fuld valuta for pengene . Havde bestilt uden morgenmad , så den kan jeg ikke udtale mig om.. Men værelset var super lækkert og rent - swimmingpoolen var fantastisk ( sætter stor pris på en svømmetur i en lækker pool , når jeg er på ferie ) .. vil til hver en tid , booke dette hotel .. Virkelig lækkert

Location and room

Perfect location standing opposite of the Union mall, with a skywalk leading to Central Plaza Ladprao.The MRT is right infront of the hotel, making it even more convenient to travel around the city. There's also a BTS station nearby for alternative route. You can travel via MRT or BTS to Jatujak weekend market for less than 5 minutes.For the hotel quality, the pool is very well maintained. The room features a large screen smart TV which you can watch Youtube and enjoy that entertainment in a nice comfortable well docorated room.
On the first day my bedsheet had some yellow/red stain on it. It was a light small stain but it looked pretty much like period.It was changed the day after but I'd say the 4-star hotel of this standard should pay more attention to details, because this stain issue could upset a lot of hotel guests.

All round a great product with great matching service and food.
Stayed for the second time .. far exceeds expectations in terms of price paid. Service from concierge and reception to housekeeping and Room service very professional and friendly. The room service food and service was quick and always tasty as was the breakfast buffet. Will definitely stay there again. Thank you.

Had many amenities such as toothbrush and hairdryer.

Check-out process was very slow, we had to wait 30 minutes for them to check our room - other guests came to check out after us and were finished in under 5 minutes. 
We cleaned our room before leaving and didn't leave a mess, so it was a little confusing why we had to wait longer than others...
The check-out staff also were not wearing masks, despite having to speak toguests from all around the world every day.
On check-in the staff didn't give any information, for example you need to use your room card to activate the lift.
This good place and service good

Good value and location.
Air conditioner smelly

This is the second I visited here. I like everything here, especially their services, both at the front reception and the restaurant. The room looks really good and comfortable. 
There is only one thing I want to ask the favor to adjust, the television. There is no netflix or other entertainment applications except youtube on the tv, and I can't install it on tv by myself. I think it would be great if we could spend time with our lover or friends by watching some movies in the hotel room because we can't do other activities like going to the pool, the club or shopping due to COVID-19. (The reason why i don't answer this paragraph on the dislike topic is because it doesn't like I dislike it at all. I enjoyed watching YouTube, but if there had been more choices, there would have been better.)

The room was beautiful, pleasant stay, bed was comfortable, location was great and breakfast was excellent.
2 staff, 1 was a girl when I checked-in.

nice, new, clean, modern city hotel. comfortable room in a good location. Front desk Staff very nice.
Well, due to the C-19 situation the food service was below expectations. The "very good" ratings from other travelers for the breakfast is currently not been met (reduced options, the croissants were at least three days old and hard/dry). But this is kind of expected as the hotel was very empty. I hope everything goes back to normal soon...

Comfortable, good-size and clean rooms.Nice pool area. Breakfast buffet was outstanding
This is completely personal but for us, the environment of the hotel felt a bit ‘cold’, we prefer smaller hotels with more personality.  
Close to metro and BTS but a bit far away from tourist attractions

The breakfast was good, quite busy but a large restaurant area including outside seating. The bed was comfortable but the room was small and oddly laid out wasting some of the space. We have stayed here previously but in a larger room, we chose the hotel due to it's location with an MRT station just outside and it's close proximity to Mo Chit for onward location.
The room was small, we initially booked for 1 night but due to Covid restrictions we stayed another night whilst planning where we were going. Our only real complaint would be with the Wi-Fi in this room didn't work very well - kept cutting out and on returning to our room we had to log back in.

The room was very comfortable and has everything you need and staff was very friendly!!!! WiFi and TV were great! I enjoyed the welcome drink and dining at the restaurant.  I would def recommend this hotel to anyone travel to Bangkok!!

Rooms are large and well funtional.

The rooms only start from the 8th floor or something so chances are you will have some sort of a view. pool on 6th floor with gym etc, really lovely. Staff all lovely, breakfast buffet good (if you're not a meat eater, pretty limited options) I am a vegan, it would be good if they had more vegan options on the menu for dinner and at brekkie. Vegetable milks, more veggie dishes, which are so easy to do. Overall I was super impressed with this hotel. Right beside MRT and 7/11

This might be the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in. Wonderful rooms, very friendly staff, good atmosphere, perfect location, delicious breakfast, big pool and everything was excellently clean.

The room was good, the bed very comfy, breakfast was good and the pool was for our stay also good. Nice gym where they have everything you need for a nice workout. A 7eleven directly next the hotel and a very good massage salon just a step outside the hotel. For our stay of 3 days a good hotel.

The gym facilities were great and the pool is awesome after a hot day exploring Bangkok. Love their green initiative by providing some form of reward. Close to the MRT as well as Union Malll for all your shopping and transportation needs. They also have a large buffet breakfast which I enjoyed. 
Absolutely nothing!

Nice room with a great view. Good breakfast but not included in the price of the room. Location isvery good thanks to the fact they finished the skytrain line till Kasetsart University.
The bedroom doors are made from cardboard so you can hear everything what is happening in the hallway.The floor in the hallway is made from the wrong material so you can hear every footstep and shoe from passing people.

Second time stay - was here over New Year too (a bit more expensive then).The breakfasts are good quality and varied. Breakfast table inside in the cool or outside by the pool (pure poerty).Location is really good now that the skytrain connections to Sukhumvit are awesome and the underground station is just outside the door (discount on subway for older farts).Very close to Union Mall and Central Mall (Cinema) - I buy most of my shirts here as they have some great deals sometimes.  Near Chatuchak market with is pretty empty now as people are scared of Corona virusSo, Value/Location/Breakfast/Comfort/Cleanliness.ALSO..... There is a really nice music bar just down the road (400 mtrs) to the right as you face Union Mall.
The only problem I can see is that the entrance to the carpark is narrow/awkward, so you will scratch the Bugatti..... but the Mazda just fits

Some excellent and cheap local restaurants. Very easy access to the metro & the Wednesday night market opposite.

The fitness and pool are so professional! The front office staff are friendly and helpful. The room is fully equipped. Recommend!

clean and comfortable room, lovely breakfast though limited hot vegetarian options, use of gym/pool after check out was perfect - meant I could shower before leaving for the airport late-afternoon.

Breakfast waste of money - cheaper and better outside.
Also when they clean rooms they leave door open and many moskito fly in room so after not knowing this, 2 days later my face was like a balloon with moskito bites, I might as well of slept on the street.
I had to pay money at pharmacy to get treated for moskito bites because of room and still go out to get a descent capoachino.
Won’t be staying here again and I’ve stayed here around 10 times in 2 years.
I will post a picture of my face after 2 nights in staying in these rooms.

Ate in the restaurant one evening. The food was average, yet expensive and they didn't have any white wine.

Really good location close to 2 malls, a big parc, metro station, a 7elevenNice big gymGreat pool and place to sunbathClean roomsGood restaurant for a good priceNice view
Not a big issue but they ask for a 500 bath deposit

The hotel was awesome and modern looking. Enjoy our stay throughout as well as the friendliness of the staffs. Overall it was a great hotel to stay at and good location too!

This is my second time. I love Swimming pool, gym, breakfast, hotel is so close to shopping mall.

lebua-at-state-tower.description:
Room was excellent, bed very comfortable.
Bar prices really were ridiculously high

lived up to the hype. can't wait to go back. put it on your to do list for sure.staff were amazing, not judgemental, room was over the top great.
location was a bit strange, but I didn't want to leave anyway.

Staff treat everyone like Movie Stars.
Tower Club zone is such a treat.
Rooftop Cocktail is a must.
Everything was great
Best staff and nice view

The staff are amazing and will go the extra mile to make you feel comfortable. Fluke, from the gym was especially friendly and helpful. 
I was rather surprised that there wasn't a welcome drink nor a fruit basket in the room.

They treat you like a movie star even before you arrive.
Its always such a treat to return to Lebua

I was really impressed with the staff, very polite and everyone of them asked if there was anything we needed. They remembered my name even though I do not remember giving it. The attendant at the gym and pool (his name is Bod) was excellent could not do enough for us. 
For people that do not drink alcohol, soft drink very expensive.

The breakfast was excellent, especially bakery items. Staff  were uniformly thoughtful, friendly and attentive.
No tissues in room. Overpriced drinks
good location great view and services.

View - stayed at a tower suite river viwe. Big room, fridge. Ashtrays in the room,( I never smoke in a bedroom, but on the balcony) :-) 
Top attentive staff :-) 
Negative: No furniture on the balcony is a big minus and too far away from Sukhumvit..... 30-50 min drive

Everything! 
Wish we could have stayed longer

We had a great time and we’re upgraded on our honeymoon! The Sky Bar has to be on your bucket list
The food and drinks are very expensive so plan for this!
The hotel is lovely but the restaurants are the best! Staff are incredibly helpful and friendly.

Room was large and comfortable. Service from staff was excellent. Room rate was very good
Extortionate prices for everything....so we didn't eat there...or visit the Sky bar...it was cheaper to go out and eat at a Michelin star restaurant about a km away!! One example...bowl of fries would have been over £13.... ridiculous!!

The room was comfy and spacious. We had a riverside view and the view was amazing.
The only small criticism were the carpets in the corridors looked like they needed a deep clean as stained in places.

I loved the staff there, most polite and helpful. I loved the design of the hotel and the cleanliness of our suite. The views from my balcony were amazing I loved my stay overall. Everything close by via taxi no more than 15-20 mins away. Lots of food stalls walkable distance however. There is a boat service near the pier that can take you to the shopping mall. One of main reason booking lebua was for the sky bar. And gym facilities.
The second day of our stay the gym was flooded and was not useable this is one of the main reason for choosing lebua yet I didn’t get to use the gym but no discounts were given for this disruption. Secondly the skybar drinks are extremely overpriced 1800 baht per drink was the cheapest. Many other amazing skybars with music etc for alot less in Bangkok.I understand the hangover was filmed here but it was too pricey and empty may i add. It didn’t feel like a bar as not many people went up there. Also upon arrival at check in they ask for a 10,000 baht deposit, if you give this in cash as i did u get it back on the day, card payments will take 5-7 days to be returned. Can’t comment on food services at hospital as didn’t use it.

The staff ,the hotel ,everything is amazing ,this is 5 star
Food in breeze was nice but at 17000 for two expensive ,yes views are amazing ,food was nice but in future would eat out

The river & city views.  
They put us on level 53. Spectacular!
All I didn't like was the very high prices they charge to eat or drink in the hotel bars & restaurants. It cost me over $700 Aud for a meal for 2 people with 2 simple drinks. Way to much.

Love good customer service I am fussy but I am happy here
Don’t know. All good.

Super spacious room with some great views over the city. Staff were super helpful, nice and welcoming upon check-in and they also let us check-in early to the room. Breakfast had lots and lots of options and of good quality - lots of staff standing by to help - including a chef to cook ham / bacon / sausages on a BBQ and someone to cut the fresh fruit. Location was good We would book again if / when back in Bangkok

Great views and friendly staff
Extremely expensive drinks during valentines day. They shud just have a minimum to spend for guests to enjoy

The hotel is very beautiful, rooms are big and luxurious with a balcony that gives you a wonderful view on the city! Staff members are lovely and the sky bar is just wow !!

Drinks are really really expensive, same for the food...

The staff were faultless and on check in we felt valued and welcomed. The personal touch really does help when you’re jet lagged and confused in a new country. The location is perfect in the old commercial hub of BK with an array of activities, drinking and eating around you (they make much of their Michelin stars there are several others within a kilometre and many Michelin recommended venues within 200m). Lebua gave us a great start to BK and a grand jump-off point for the rest of the city and beyond
And here’s where it cuts. The suite was dated and lacked the facilities I expect from an hotel of this class - no modern conveniences (USB charging, functional WiFi, functional coffee) but I wonder if that was because we were a lower floor, superior suite. Having stayed at the Marina Bay Sands (my bar now for these establishments) Lebua State Tower drew short. 
But hey, it was £90 a night so what do we expect...
Well, yes, that would be fair until you try to experience the Skybar. As residents we were still shuttled into the holding pen of Distil with the walk-in trade, and there was no option to skip the queue (as in MBS). For an iconic venue where people literally stay in the establishment for that caveat... I was a bit irritated by this. You buy a (grotesquely priced) cocktail and once finished you are ushered into the skybar (but only photos in certain spots please...).  Walk in trade; fine I get that. It costs a lot to maintain an iconic venue and you can’t lose out to opportunist selfie hunters, but your guests have already funnelled several hundred pounds into your tills... we’d appreciate a little understanding for that. 
But the markets the market. Lebua clearly aim their lower tier suites at basic travellers seeking a status symbol check in for a short stay. I raise my hand - I am that basic bitch. But at the same time, I could have halved my bill and stayed in the Marriott down the road. Instead I chose an iconic venue and feel a little taken-advantage-of. 
If Lebua don’t want riffraff like me than upgrade your rooms, triple your rates to Shangri-La levels, and charge me B1000 to come up the lift and take a photo on the terrace.

Staff are so friendly and helpful. Room was spacious with lots of storage. View from the river view balconies is amazing, especially at night. Breakfast was absolutely brilliant. 
The restaurants are so overpriced! When we arrived we were starving after a long flight. Nipped to the pool area for quick bite to eat. Ended up sharing a simple margarita pizza that was £20 and shared a small £5 bottle of water. We were horrified. Safe to say we didn’t eat anywhere in the hotel again. The rooftop bar is even worse. £60 for a basic and I mean basic gin and tonic and one cocktail. We stayed for one and then left. We were also told we couldn’t take pictures until we had been to the bar so don’t expect to just go up to enjoy the view and leave again, even as a hotel guest. The soundproofing between the rooms is terrible. We had a couple next to us arguing into the early hours of the morning and then let’s just say we heard them make up again. The rooms themselves are pretty basic for a 5 star hotel. No frills. The bathroom is large but quite dated especially the shower.

Outstanding service from staff, from the minute you arrive to check out. They really do know how to make guests feel welcome. Nice room, great view. Breakfast selection was the best we´ve ever seen.
There´s a certain cagey-ness to visiting the onsite restaurants. Very disappointing in fact. When you arrive you are given a beautiful map and brochure advertising the various bars & restaurants on site. However - try find a menu and pricing - it´s nigh impossible. So we followed dress code rules etc, which is no problem at all and asked to go for a drink at the famed Sky Bar on one evening of our stay.We were whisked up to the top floor, only to then be dropped two floors down and taken to their Pink Champagne Bar - where we were led to a table & pressed repeatedly to stay and enjoy the view there. We said over & over no thanks & left the Pink Bar asking again to be taken to the Sky bar. So we go up again, and then are led YET again into another bar - this time the Whisky bar. Again NOT where we wanted to be. At this point we had a menu shoved in our face and we were told that ONLY if we order a drink at this bar we could go to the Sky Bar. WHAT?So we left - disgruntled to say the least. Before going back down, I managed to enter Scirocco and the Sky Bar area - but after having been shoved and pushed around - where the aim was definitely to force you to order OVER priced drinks at numerous bars before giving you what you want - we decided against eating at their restaurant the next night and left feeling rather disgusted at the service. We were paying to be in the hotel - we were not riff raff off the street. The sneakiness of also not allowing guests to see the menu before making a reservation at the restaurants (for which you must also pay a deposit - even if you are already a hotel guest who has ALREADY paid a deposit on check in of 10,000 Baht) - is also rude. I struggle to understand why they would not publish their menus and pricing - would they rather embarrass their guests when they realise that dinner may cost more than they realise? I have been to many Chefs Table and fine dining restaurants - & never been treated this way.
